headline: Zefiro Founder and Former Chairman Requisitions Shareholders Meeting and intends to Nominate Five Directors to the Board of Directors of Zefiro Methane
summary: Zefiro’s largest shareholder calls for change to replace self-serving and conflicted board that is destroying shareholder valueTORONTO, Nov. 20, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Dr. Talal A. Debs, Founder and Director of Zefiro Methane Corp. (Cboe: ZEFI) ("Zefiro"), today announced that he is nominating five highly qualified candidates for election to Zefiro’s board of directors (the “Board”) at Zefiro’s next annual and special meeting of shareholders (the “Meeting”). Dr. Debs’ nominees include himself,

headline: Bekaert - Update on the Share Buyback Program and Liquidity Agreement
summary: Update on the Share Buyback Program and the Liquidity Agreement Period from 13 November 2025 to 19 November 2025 Share Buyback ProgramBekaert announces today that it has completed the fourth tranche of its € 200 million share buyback program. During the tranche, which started 31 July 2025 and ended on 14 November 2025, the company repurchased 667 653 ordinary shares for an aggregate consideration of € 25 million. headline: OSB GROUP PLC - Transaction in Own Shares
summary: OSB GROUP PLC ISIN: GB00BLDRH36021 November 2025 LEI number: 213800ZBKL9BHSL2K459 OSB GROUP PLC (the “Company”) Transaction in Own Shares The Company announces that on 20 November 2025 it had purchased a total of 94,177 of its ordinary shares of £0.01 each (the "ordinary shares") on the London Stock Exchange, CBOE BXE and CBOE CXE, through the Company's broker Citigroup Global Markets Limited as detailed below. The repurchased ordinary shares will be cancelled. London Stock ExchangeCBOE BXECBOE

headline: Market Anxiety Picked Up Thursday
summary: For much of this year, traders have raced to pick up bullish bets tied to the market's continued surge. That shifted Thursday. Trading in put options surged to the third-highest level of the year, approaching levels seen around Liberation Day in April, when fears of higher tariffs tanked stocks.

content.title: Market Anxiety Picked Up Thursday
content.summary: For much of this year, traders have raced to pick up bullish bets tied to the market's continued surge. That shifted Thursday. Trading in put options surged to the third-highest level of the year, approaching levels seen around Liberation Day in April, when fears of higher tariffs tanked stocks.
